Key Match Events: The Golden State Warriors got back to winning ways with a 107-104 victory over the Detroit Pistons on Thursday, Jan. 9.
Four of Steve Kerr's starting five finished the game with double-digit scoring performances, including an impressive 14-point, 10-rebound double-double from sophomore big man Trayce Jackson-Davis.
Gui Santos came off the bench to lead the second unit in scoring with 13 points, pulled down five rebounds, dished out three assists, and recorded two steals.
Santos hit four of his six shot attempts, all from 3-point range, and went 1-of-2 from the free-throw line.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shortly after the Warriors win, their social media team released a highlights package of Santos' performance on their YouTube channel.
Santos is rarely featured within Kerr's rotation, so the boost he provided from the bench was undoubtedly a welcome one.
